module.name: project_breakdown
module.keywords: module, systems engineering, project breakdown, project management, product breakdown

abstract.li: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for relationships between project, product, associated breakdowns and properties

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of relationships between project, product, associated breakdowns and properties

The Project_breakdown_arm is about the identification of a project and product structure, i.e. how a project is defined and a product is assembled, categorized, and version controlled. Some projects and products exist and evolve over many years with many product releases and updates. This arm contains information about the identification of the configuration of a project or product for a given product concept as it evolves over time.

It contains the definition of a project, of its responsible organization and of its planned and actual execution dates. It contains the association of a project to activity and product data, and the relationships among projects. It contains the information to identify a planned product or an actual product.

The Project_breakdown_arm contains the information that identifies a product or a product version and the inclusion of a product or product version in a product category. It contains the characterization of a version of a product, suitable for one or more application domains and one or more life-cycle stages. It contains the context-dependent relationship among product definitions such as the fact that one or more versions of products are used in another product.

The Project_breakdown_arm contains the identification of a hierarchical breakdown of a product and the identification of the elements that comprise a breakdown. It includes the identification of parent-child relationships between breakdown elements, and the identification of relationships between elements in different breakdowns.

It contains the identification of a kind of product from user requirements. It contains identification of a set of products grouped together for a common purpose, such as sales/marketing, analysis, production, usage, support activity, support solution and disposal It contains the reference to the stakeholder for the group, who causes the creation of the group, along with the identification of a group as a subset of another group. It contains the list of common characteristics which is shared by the members of the group, such as scheduled for maintenance, sales, upgrading.
It contains the identification of project and product information selected for configuration management activities.
